metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2383 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The adjust_branches function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.5 does not consider the delta in the backward-jump case, whichallows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory bycreating a packet filter and then loading crafted BPF instructions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2383` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-11.26
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-11.26
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-11.26').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.5').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
